definition: to put down in writing/to take down notes/transcript/record
pen/pencil/writing brush/to write or compose/the strokes of Chinese characters/classifier for sums of money, deals/CL:支[zhi1],枝[zhi1]

sentences.english: The deliberations shall be recorded in writing, and the transcript shall be signed by the members of the collegial panel.
sentences.chinese: 評議應當製作筆錄，由合議庭成員簽名。

sentences.english: The old woman prefers to write her letters rather than dictate others.
sentences.chinese: 這位老婦人寧願自己寫信，而不願口授給人筆錄。

sentences.english: Dissenting opinions in the deliberations must be truthfully entered in the transcript.
sentences.chinese: 評議中的不同意見，必須如實記入筆錄。

sentences.english: If the person interrogated refuses to sign his name or press down his fingerprint, it shall be indicated in the notes.
sentences.chinese: 對被盤問人拒絕簽名和捺指印的，應當在筆錄上註明。

sentences.english: The undertakers shall also sign their names on the notes.
sentences.chinese: 案件承辦人也應當在筆錄上簽名。

sentences.english: The court record shall be signed or sealed by the parties and other participants in the proceedings.
sentences.chinese: 法庭筆錄由當事人和其他訴訟參與人簽名或者蓋章。

sentences.english: The record of inquires is the official litigation document made by investigators.
sentences.chinese: 訊問筆錄是由偵查人員製作的法定訴訟文書。

sentences.english: Reporter reads Zhang the inquiry record.
sentences.chinese: 記者看到張某的詢問筆錄。

sentences.english: Please read this record of inquiry.
Any revision of an inquiry transcript shall be confirmed by the inquired parties, with their seals or fingerprints affixed thereto .
sentences.chinese: 筆錄中修改處應當由被詢問人蓋章或者捺指印認可。

sentences.english: I can take dictation in English at 100 words per minute.
sentences.chinese: 我能用英語筆錄每分鐘100個單詞。

sentences.english: The following is an exact transcript of this podcast.
sentences.chinese: 以下是播音員的精準筆錄。

sentences.english: The courtroom record shall be given to the parties to read or shall be read out to them.
sentences.chinese: 法庭筆錄應當交給當事人閱讀或者向他宣讀。

definition: to eliminate/to sack/to remove from office
to file away/to place on file
